cookies.description: File to load additional cookies from

cookies-from-browser.description: Name of the browser to load cookies from, with optional domain prefixed with '/', keyring name prefixed with '+', profile prefixed with ':', and container prefixed with '::' ('none' for no container (default), 'all' for all containers)

password.description: Password belonging to the given username

abort.description: Stop current extractor(s) after N consecutive file downloads were skipped. Specify a TARGET to set how many levels to ascend or to which subcategory to jump to. Examples: '-A 3', '-A 3:2', '-A 3:manga'

chapter-filter.description: Like '--filter', but applies to manga chapters and other delegated URLs

chapter-range.description: Like '--range', but applies to manga chapters and other delegated URLs

clear-cache.description: Delete cached login sessions, cookies, etc. for MODULE (ALL to delete everything)

config-ignore.description: Do not read default configuration files

config-open.description: Open configuration file in external application

config-toml.description: Additional configuration files in TOML format

config-yaml.description: Additional configuration files in YAML format

download-archive.description: Record successfully downloaded files in FILE and skip downloading any file already in it

filename.description: Filename format string for downloaded files ('/O' for "original" filenames)

filesize-max.description: Do not download files larger than SIZE (e.g. 500k or 2.5M)

filesize-min.description: Do not download files smaller than SIZE (e.g. 500k or 2.5M)

filter.description: Python expression controlling which files to download. Files for which the expression evaluates to False are ignored. Available keys are the filename-specific ones listed by '-K'. Example: --filter "image_width >= 1000 and rating in ('s', 'q')"

help.description: Print this help message and exit

input-file.description: Download URLs found in FILE ('-' for stdin). More than one --input-file can be specified

input-file-comment.description: Download URLs found in FILE. Comment them out after they were downloaded successfully.

input-file-delete.description: Download URLs found in FILE. Delete them after they were downloaded successfully.

no-mtime.description: Do not set file modification times according to Last-Modified HTTP response headers

no-skip.description: Do not skip downloads; overwrite existing files

range.description: Index range(s) specifying which files to download. These can be either a constant value, range, or slice (e.g. '5', '8-20', or '1:24:3')

retries.description: Maximum number of retries for failed HTTP requests or -1 for infinite retries

sleep.description: Number of seconds to wait before each download. This can be either a constant value or a range (e.g. 2.7 or 2.0-3.5)

sleep-429.description: Number of seconds to wait when receiving a '429 Too Many Requests' response

sleep-extractor.description: Number of seconds to wait before starting data extraction for an input URL

sleep-request.description: Number of seconds to wait between HTTP requests during data extraction

source-address.description: Client-side IP address to bind to

terminate.description: Stop current & parent extractors and proceed with the next input URL after N consecutive file downloads were skipped

update-check.description: Check if a newer version is available

Print.description: Like --print, but downloads files as well

Print-to-file.description: Like --print-to-file, but downloads files as well

error-file.description: Add input URLs which returned an error to FILE

list-extractors.description: Print a list of extractor classes with description, (sub)category and example URL

list-keywords.description: Print a list of available keywords and example values for the given URLs

list-modules.description: Print a list of available extractor modules

no-colors.description: Do not emit ANSI color codes in output

print.description: Write FORMAT during EVENT (default 'prepare') to standard output instead of downloading files. Can be used multiple times. Examples: 'id' or 'post:{md5[:8]}'

print-to-file.description: Append FORMAT during EVENT to FILE instead of downloading files. Can be used multiple times

print-traffic.description: Display sent and read HTTP traffic

resolve-json.description: Print JSON information; resolve intermediary URLs

resolve-urls.description: Print URLs instead of downloading; resolve intermediary URLs

simulate.description: Simulate data extraction; do not download anything

write-pages.description: Write downloaded intermediary pages to files in the current directory to debug problems

write-unsupported.description: Write URLs, which get emitted by other extractors but cannot be handled, to FILE

cbz.description: Store downloaded files in a CBZ archive

exec.description: Execute CMD for each downloaded file. Supported replacement fields are {} or {_path}, {_directory}, {_filename}. Example: --exec "convert {} {}.png && rm {}"

exec-after.description: Execute CMD after all files were downloaded. Example: --exec-after "cd {_directory} && convert * ../doc.pdf"

mtime.description: Set file modification times according to metadata selected by NAME. Examples: 'date' or 'status[date]'

no-postprocessors.description: Do not run any post processors

rename.description: Rename previously downloaded files from FORMAT to the current filename format

rename-to.description: Rename previously downloaded files from the current filename format to FORMAT

ugoira.description: Convert Pixiv Ugoira to FMT using FFmpeg. Supported formats are 'webm', 'mp4', 'gif', 'vp8', 'vp9', 'vp9-lossless', 'copy', 'zip'.

write-info-json.description: Write gallery metadata to a info.json file

write-metadata.description: Write metadata to separate JSON files

write-tags.description: Write image tags to separate text files

zip.description: Store downloaded files in a ZIP archive
